docs.snippet: Delegates from the South American Governments to the International American Congress, to be held in Washington Oct. 2, are arriving in New-York.
docs.lead_paragraph: Delegates from the South American Governments to the International American Congress, to be held in Washington Oct. 2, are arriving in New-York.

headline.main: GREETING THE DELEGATES; VISITORS FROM SOUTH AMERICAN STATES.THE CITY OF BRINGS FOUR DELEGATES TO THE INTERNATIONAL AMERICAN CONGRESS.

docs.snippet: Dr. Manuel Quintana and Dr. Roque Saenz Pefia, delegates from the Argentine Republic to the International American Congress, and Dr. Alberto Niu, delegate from Uruguay to the same body, arrived in New-York yesterday on the steamship City of Paris.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Manuel Quintana and Dr. Roque Saenz Pefia, delegates from the Argentine Republic to the International American Congress, and Dr. Alberto Niu, delegate from Uruguay to the same body, arrived in New-York yesterday on the steamship City of Paris.

headline.main: SOUTH AMERICANS HERE.; DISTINGUISHED DELEGATES TO THE INTERNATIONAL CONGRESS ARRIVE.

docs.snippet: "The needs of the country demand," said Mr. DEPEW in his address to the Republican delegates at Saratoga, "that the protection of our industries shall be supplemented by every effort to find for their surplus a market."
docs.lead_paragraph: "The needs of the country demand," said Mr. DEPEW in his address to the Republican delegates at Saratoga, "that the protection of our industries shall be supplemented by every effort to find for their surplus a market."
docs.abstract: Trade with United States; C. M. Depew's Views

docs.snippet: The delegates to the International American Congress started off on the forty days' tour tendered them by the United States Government yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: The delegates to the International American Congress started off on the forty days' tour tendered them by the United States Government yesterday.

headline.main: ALL HAVING A ROYAL TIME.; THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT'S GUESTS DELIGHTED. DELEGATES TO THE INTERNATIONAL AMERICAN CONGRESS REACH JERSEY CITY AND LEAVE FOR WEST POINT.

docs.snippet: MANCHESTER, N.H., Oct 8.--The international excursion party last night, for the first time in the experience of many of the delegates and attaches of the International American Congress, slept in the cars of the special train.
docs.lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, N.H., Oct 8.--The international excursion party last night, for the first time in the experience of many of the delegates and attaches of the International American Congress, slept in the cars of the special train.

headline.main: OUR SOUTHERN GUESTS.; THE PAN-AMERICAN DELEGATES IN NEW-HAMPSHIRE AND MAINE.

docs.snippet: --At the Paris Exposition many of  the South American republics show specimens of the product known locally as Yerba Mate or Paraguayan tea, and derived from the terrified leaves and stalks of different species of ilex.
docs.lead_paragraph: --At the Paris Exposition many of the South American republics show specimens of the product known locally as Yerba Mate or Paraguayan tea, and derived from the terrified leaves and stalks of different species of ilex.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16.--The diplomatic reception room of the State Department presented a scene of unusual brilliancy this morning when Secretary Blaine received the delegates to the International Marine Conference.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16.--The diplomatic reception room of the State Department presented a scene of unusual brilliancy this morning when Secretary Blaine received the delegates to the International Marine Conference.
docs.abstract: List of Governments Represented and Delegates

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18.--After a recess of over six weeks the delegates to the International American Congress were called together at 11 o'clock this morning by secretary Blaine, the presiding officer.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18.--After a recess of over six weeks the delegates to the International American Congress were called together at 11 o'clock this morning by secretary Blaine, the presiding officer.
